summary: A thought just occurred me looking at crit role stats - the party has been together for nearly 6 months at this point. This...
body:
A thought just occurred me looking at crit role stats - the party has been together for nearly 6 months at this point. This means Caleb and Nott have been the Mighty Nein for almost the same amount of time as the two had known each other prior to meeting the others (so a full year for these too). I say this because we know how close these two were before the campaign even started and how they would drop everything to protect each other. And as much as I would have loved to see that development, it’s really neat seeing this loyalty and care across the entire group naturally flourish over the course of these six months with the Mighty Nein.

It makes me wonder if campaign 2 started now (a la campaign 1 style) instead of level 2 where we first met them, how differently would we view their varied and complicated relationships without the knowledge of what they had all suffered together?

summary: I really don't understand why there's been a sudden surge in open negativity towards ships, characters, and cast members. Have...
body:
I really don’t understand why there’s been a sudden surge in open negativity towards ships, characters, and cast members. Have the US kids gone on summer break and have more time to post wank? Is that it?

It really is a tragedy that older fandom doctrines such as “don’t like don’t read” and similar have fallen by the wayside. The existence of people who actively label themselves as “anti-[character]” or its even worse cousin, “anti-[cast member],” is really just… sad and disheartening. This is a community known for its positivity, friendliness, and kindness. I’d hate to see that starting to shatter. Hopefully everything I’ve seen or heard of second hand comes from a vocal but tiny minority, but even a handful of loud assholes can ruin things for everyone.

On a related note – you’re not obligated to keep engaging with a piece of media if it’s not doing it for you. If any part of it feels sour to you, you owe it to your mental health to either stop engaging or to carefully consider how you do. You should not, however, go after players because you think they’re playing Dungeons and Dragons wrong.

If you don’t ship something, that’s fine! Even if its a popular ship! Tumblr Savior, Xkit, and the website itself have word blacklisting functions. You should not, however, make your dislike of a ship everyone else’s problem and start taking out your issues via tagged hate, harassment, etc etc.

Think about how you engage with media. Really look at it. If you realize you’re dedicating your time to hate - hate watching and the like - it’d be a good idea to reconsider how that time is spent. Focusing on what you enjoy vs what you don’t can make a positive change in your outlook and attitude.

As Brian says every week, “Don’t forget to love each other.” I feel like we need to focus on that more lately.

summary: Shabby & Unkempt - BrenH - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
title: Shabby & Unkempt - BrenH - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Every few weeks the party would spend an evening cutting each other’s hair, lest it get too shabby or unkempt. Or, if it did, for them to tease each other until it was fixed.

2.7k words, taking place during episode 62

blog.name: kimabutch
blog.title: Revolutionary
blog.description: I'm Charlie! I'm attempting to tag "cr spoilers" until the subsequent Tuesday, but don't expect perfection. I'm into a lot of things — right now it's mostly Critical Role, but Utena still owns my heart. 22, butch lesbian, she/her. Link to asks!

summary: I saw you posted a song like “i know this describes Someone, but who??” and i have a song like that too: “tickle me pink” by...
question: I saw you posted a song like “i know this describes Someone, but who??” and i have a song like that too: “tickle me pink” by Johnny flynn. i think it reminds me of nott, especially with lines like “don’t know where i can find myself a brand new pair of ears, don’t know where i can buy a heart- the one i’ve got is shoddy, i need a brand new body, and then i can have a brand new start” but other than that i don’t know? thoughts??
answer:
I agree that it works well for Nott!! I think the weird but lovely instrumentation meshes with her personality, and all the farming references are appropriate to her childhood in Felderwin. And there’s a lot about being dissatisfied with yourself — “I’ve never been as sweet,” or “I’ve rolled around the orchard/ And found myself too awkward.”

Not to mention a persistence even through the worst circumstances, in an effort to get home:

“I wish I was home and tucked away/
When nothing goes right/ 
And the future’s dark as night/ 
What you need is a sunny, sunny day”

Come yell at me about songs that remind you of Critical Role! (Playlist | song masterlist & spreadsheet by disasterhumans | CR music tag)

and fantasy geography is as confusing as real life geogrpahy I'm sorry
also thank you so much for that ask
summary: Is the Exandrian Song Contest mostly based in Tal'Dorei or does it span multiple continents? I think it'd be hilarious if one...
question: Is the Exandrian Song Contest mostly based in Tal'Dorei or does it span multiple continents? I think it'd be hilarious if one random country from another continent joined in (the Menagerie Coast maybe?), and everyone complains that "they don't even go here" (like Australia in Eurovision) XD
answer: Exandria is the name of the entire world though, right? It WOULD be funny to have that kind of outlier, but I don’t have enough of an overview of the world to know which city or country is where… Is Syngorn even in Tal’Dorei? I don’t know :’D And getting all of Exandria in it is good too, because then it can just stay the ESC xD

summary: Fic title: Smoke on the Water
question: Fic title: Smoke on the Water
answer:
Jester and Molly are mermaids who always have been too curious for their own good. Even though their clan and families have always warned them about going to the surface, Jester and Molly find themselves drawn to the human beaches and cities, followed by Yasha who wants to protect her best friends from any danger. Being the only shark-type of their clan, Yasha scares most merpeople away easily, but Molly and Jester have always been by her side.

After some boat following shenanigans and secret visiting of beaches at night, the three of them find two humans sitting on a landing bridge. Yasha can’t say if Molly or Jester gave them away in the end, all she knows is that she finds herself in way too deep with her two best friends who insist on coming back and talking to the strange humans who act like siblings but look nothing alike. Along the way they rescue a drowning sailor, find a goblin walking on water and a strange guy with pink hair who can make himself breathe under water even though he’s not a mermaid at all.

send me a made-up fic title and i’ll tell you what i would write to go with it
